intro: Willughbeia gigantea, commonly known as the giant willughbeia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a large, evergreen shrub or small tree that can grow up to 10 meters tall. The plant has broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces woody, spiny fruits. Willughbeia gigantea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and swamps.
